Detailed Description

Abstract base class for all sockets.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum Socket::Event
 

Enumerator:
c_event_data_received  Data has been received, it can be read from the socket.
c_event_data_sent  Data has been sent, it can be written to the socket.
c_event_conn_established  Connection to remote peer established (connection oriented sockets only).
c_event_conn_failed  Connection to remote peer failed (connection oriented sockets only).
c_event_conn_closed  Connection closed by remote peer (connection oriented sockets only).
c_event_conn_req_pending  The socket is waiting on a connection request (sent for server sockets only).
c_event_bearer_lost  The data connection bearer used by this socket has been abruptly lost.

virtual BOOLEAN Socket::IsBlocking (   )  const [pure virtual]
 

Tells if the socket is in blocking mode.

Implemented in SerialTerminalSocket, SerialSocket, and InetSocket.

BOOLEAN Socket::IsInstanceValid (  const Socket *  socket  )  [static]
 

Checks if socket is a pointer to a valid socket. If the socket has been deleted then the pointer points to an invalid memory area. This method provides means to check if socket is still existing which is used e.g. when you get a pointer to a socket within a message.

Parameters:
socket The socket pointer to check for validity.

virtual BOOLEAN Socket::IsOpen (   )  const [pure virtual]
 

Implemented in SerialTerminalSocket, SerialSocket, and InetSocket.

void Socket::OnControlMsg (  const SocketControlMsg &  msg  )  [protected, virtual]
 

Translates the socket control message msg into a socket event and routes it accordingly. If a listener is set, its OnSocketEvent method is called. Otherwise the messages are discarded.

Reimplemented in SerialSocket, InetSocket, TcpServerSocket, TcpSocket, and UdpSocket.

virtual INT Socket::Read (  void *  buf,
INT  buflen
)  [pure virtual]
 

Reads data from the socket.

Parameters:
buf Pointer to read buffer.
buflen Length of read buffer.
Returns:
Number of bytes written or -1 on failure.

Implemented in SerialTerminalSocket, SerialSocket, InetSocket, and TcpSocket.

virtual BOOLEAN Socket::SetBlocking (  BOOLEAN  block = FALSE  )  [pure virtual]
 

Enables/disables blocking mode on sockets. Changing blocking mode with pending Read() or Write() requests may produce unpredictable results. Using APOXI sockets in blocking mode is depreciated, APOXI sockets default to non-blocking mode. Socket events are sent to the socket independent of the blocking mode.

Implemented in SerialTerminalSocket, SerialSocket, and InetSocket.

virtual void Socket::SetSocketEventListener (  SocketEventListener *  listener  )  [inline, virtual]
 

Sets the socket listener to receive callbacks when socket events occur. The application holding the listener and the observed socket must be within the same application context!

Parameters:
listener The socket listener.

Reimplemented in SerialTerminalSocket.

virtual INT Socket::Write (  const void *  buf,
INT  buflen
)  [pure virtual]
 

Writes data to the socket.

Parameters:
buf Pointer to write buffer.
buflen Length of write buffer.
Returns:
Number of bytes written or -1 on failure.

Implemented in SerialTerminalSocket, SerialSocket, InetSocket, TcpSocket, and LcsSocket.
